author: Emre Peker
title: U.S., Japan and EU Trade Officials to Meet Amid Steel-Tariff Uproar
text:
BRUSSELS—Top trade officials from the U.S., Japan and the European Union are set to meet in the EU capital on Saturday, a European official said, as President Donald Trump’s planned global tariffs on steel and aluminum threatens their alliance to counter China’s growing economic clout.
U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer and his Japanese counterpart Hiroshige Seko will convene in Brussels with EU Trade Commissioner Cecilia Malmstrom, according to the official, who is with the European Commission, the bloc’s executive.
...
